snippet: The House spending bills still must be reconciled with Senate measures. But by setting an initial bargaining level so low, Republicans are signaling they are preparing for battle.
abstract: Republican-controlled House Appropriations Committee is producing spending bills that slash or severely cutting spending, particularly for many of the Obama administration's efforts to implement regulations, signalling that Republicans are preparing for a budget fight that will come in the heat of the 2012 campaign.
lead_paragraph: The House spending bills still must be reconciled with Senate measures. But by setting an initial bargaining level so low, Republicans are signaling they are preparing for battle.

headline.main: House Bill Takes a Scythe to Spending
headline.print_headline: House Bill Takes a Scythe to Spending
